contentrichtext.text: {{coord|25|0|N|39|30|E|display=title}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Madinah | native_name = | official_name = المدينة المنورة | settlement_type = [[Emirates of Saudi Arabia|Province]] | image_skyline = | imagesize = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_flag = | flag_size = | flag_alt = | image_shield = | shield_size = | shield_alt = | image_map = Al Madinah in Saudi Arabia.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = Map of Saudi Arabia with Madinah highlighted | latd = |latm = |lats = |latNS = N | longd = |longm = |longs = |longEW = W | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_type = type:adm1st_region:SA | coordinates_display = inline,title | seat_type = [[Capital (political)|Capital]] | seat = [[Medina]] | parts_type = [[Mintaqah|Manatiq (Districts)]] | parts_style = para | p1 = 7 | area_total_km2 = 151990 | area_footnotes = | population_as_of = 2004 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 1512724 | population_note = | population_blank1_title = | population_blank1 = | population_blank2_title = | population_blank2 = | population_density_km2 = 9.95 | demographics1_name1 = | demographics1_info1 = | demographics_type2 = | demographics2_name1 = | demographics2_info1 = | demographics2_name2 = | demographics2_info2 = | demographics2_name3 = | demographics2_info3 = | blank1_name_sec1 = | blank1_info_sec1 = | blank2_name_sec1 = | blank2_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = | blank_info_sec2 = | blank1_name_sec2 = | blank1_info_sec2 = | blank2_name_sec2 = | blank2_info_sec2 = | postal_code_type = [[ISO 3166-2:SA|ISO 3166-2]] | postal_code = 03 | leader_title = Governor - Emir | leader_name = [[Faisal bin Salman]] | leader_party = | website = | footnotes = }} The '''Madinah Province''' ({{lang-ar|المدينة المنورة}} ''Al-Madīnah al-Munawarah'') is a [[Emirates of Saudi Arabia|province]] of [[Saudi Arabia]], located on the country's west side, along the [[Red Sea]] coast. It has an area of 151,990 km² and a population of 1,512,724 (2004 Census), subdivided into seven [[governorates]] ([[Muhafazah|''muḥafaẓat'']]): {| class="wikitable" |- |'''Governorate''' |'''Population''' |- |Al-Madinah |995,619 |- |Al Hunakiyah |52,549 |- |Mahd Al Thahab |53,687 |- |Al 'Ula |57,495 |- |Badr |58,088 |- |Khaybar |45,489 |- |Yanbu Al Bahar |249,797 |} Its capital is the sacred city of [[Madinah]].<ref name=tguide>{{cite web|title=Medina|url=http://trawellguide.com/travel-guide-destination.php?id=2545&title=Medina|publisher=Trawell Guide|accessdate=25 August 2012}}</ref> Other cities in the Province include [[Yanbu' al Bahr]] and [[Badr (city)|Badr Hunayn]]. It also contains [[Mada'in Saleh]], a pre-Islamic [[UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Site]].<ref name=unesco>{{cite web | title = USESCO and Saudi Arabia: A Snapshot Picture | publisher = UNESCO | url = http://www.unesco.org/eri/cp/factsheets/SAU_facts_figures.pdf |accessdate=2012-11-17}}</ref> == Governors == * [[Muhammad bin Abdul-Aziz Al Saud|Muhammad bin Abdulaziz]] (1924-1965) * Abdul Muhsin bin Abdulaziz (1965-1985) *[[Abdul-Majeed bin Abdul-Aziz|Abdul Majeed bin Abdulaziz]] (1986-1999) *[[Muqrin bin Abdul-Aziz|Muqrin bin Abdulaziz]] (1999-2005) *[[Abdulaziz bin Majid]] (2005-2013) <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.gulfinthemedia.com/index.php?m=gcc_press&id=2243672&cnt=171&lang=en&PHPSESSID=8|title=Governor of Madinah Province Receives UN Under-Secretary-General - gcc_press|newspaper=Gulf in the Media|date=6 June 2010|accessdate=25 August 2012}}</ref> *[[Faisal bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]] (2013- == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.imaratalmadinah.gov.sa/ Emirate of Al Madinah] Official website {{Geographic location |Centre = Al Madinah Province |North = [[Tabuk Province]] |Northeast = [[Ha'il Province]]<br>[[Qasim Province]] |East = [[Riyadh Province]] |Southeast = |South = [[Makkah Province]] |Southwest = |West = ''[[Red Sea]]'' |Northwest = }} {{Saudi Arabia}} {{Saudi Arabia topics}} [[Category:Al Madinah Province| ]] [[Category:Provinces of Saudi Arabia]] {{SaudiArabia-geo-stub}}
